{{cpp/experimental/ranges/title|Same}}
{{cpp/experimental/ranges/concepts/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=experimental/ranges/concepts|since=ranges|1=
template&lt; class T, class U &gt;
concept bool Same = std::is_same&lt;T, U&gt;::value; // see below
}}

The concept {{tt|Same&lt;T, U&gt;}} is satisfied if and only if {{tt|T}} and {{tt|U}} denote the same type.

Despite being specified using it, there need not be any subsumption relationship between {{c|Same&lt;T, U&gt;}} and {{c|std::is_same&lt;T, U&gt;::value}}.

For the purposes of constraint checking, {{c|Same&lt;T, U&gt;}} implies {{c|Same&lt;U, T&gt;}}.

===Notes===
The additional requirement on constraint checking differentiates {{tt|Same}} from {{lc|std::is_same}}.
